Content: President Maithripala Sirisena says that he will not allow to increase salaries of Parliamentarians. The President said this while attending the opening ceremony of the Pibidemu Polonnaruwa Market complex. The Pibidemu Polonnaruwa Market Complex was opened as another project of Pibidemu Polonnaruwa Development program. 64 million rupees has been spent to build the complex. The new shopping complex has been built for the trade stalls removed due to the constructions of walking path in Polonnaruwa. Addressing the gathering the President said that at a time when attempts are made to resolve economic problems including the increase in cost of living, it is not suitable to increase salaries of Parliamentarians. Meanwhile President Maithripala Sirisena who went to open Polonnaruwa Royal College Cricket Ground under the Pibidemu Polonnaruwa program met a talented youngster. He is K.R. Shalika Lakshan studying at grade 9 of that school. His speech at the function drew the attention of the President. The President has promised him to give him a gift. When he went to collect the gift, the President went with him to his home. President Maithripala Sirisena examined the certificates won by Lakshan for debating competitions and other extracurricular activities. His father is a fisherman who maintains the family of three including a sister studying at a university. The President also pledged to make their dream of a house a reality.
